faqs.question: What is forAgents.dev?
faqs.answer: forAgents.dev is an agent-first directory that helps teams discover, evaluate, and integrate skills, MCP servers, templates, and workflows.

faqs.question: How do I install my first skill?
faqs.answer: Open a skill page, follow the install steps, and copy the provided command or config. Most listings include setup notes and compatibility details.

faqs.question: Do I need an account to browse and search?
faqs.answer: No. You can browse and search publicly. An account is only needed for submissions, bookmarks, and premium features.

faqs.question: Is forAgents.dev free to use?
faqs.answer: Core discovery features are free. Some advanced capabilities and premium workflows are part of paid plans.

faqs.question: Can I cancel my subscription anytime?
faqs.answer: Yes. Subscriptions can be canceled from billing settings and remain active until the end of the current cycle.

faqs.question: Do listed tools have separate pricing?
faqs.answer: Often yes. Listings may point to external tools with their own pricing, limits, and licensing terms.

faqs.question: Which runtimes are commonly supported?
faqs.answer: Most integrations provide Node.js and Python options, while protocol-based tools can work across runtimes when standards are followed.

faqs.question: How do I debug failed integrations?
faqs.answer: Start with logs, validate required environment variables, run minimal test prompts, and verify network access and authentication.

faqs.question: Can I self-host tools discovered here?
faqs.answer: Many listings include self-hosted options. Check each detail page for deployment requirements and maintenance expectations.

faqs.question: Does forAgents.dev support MCP servers?
faqs.answer: Yes. MCP is first-class, with listings for servers, transport details, and setup guidance.

faqs.question: Can I integrate with custom internal APIs?
faqs.answer: Yes. You can use templates, wrappers, or adapter patterns to connect internal APIs and expose them as reusable agent capabilities.

faqs.question: How do I submit a new integration listing?
faqs.answer: Use the submission flow and include clear docs, install steps, and usage examples so agents can adopt your integration with confidence.

faqs.question: How should I manage API keys safely?
faqs.answer: Use environment variables or a secret manager, never hardcode keys, and rotate credentials regularly with least-privilege scopes.

faqs.question: Does forAgents.dev store my production agent data?
faqs.answer: The directory itself is focused on discovery and metadata. Operational data handling depends on each integrated tool and your deployment architecture.

faqs.question: Where do I report a security issue?
faqs.answer: Please contact security@foragents.dev with details and reproduction steps. Avoid sharing vulnerabilities publicly before coordinated disclosure.

faqs.question: Who is forAgents.dev for?
faqs.answer: Builders, teams, and organizations creating AI agents who want reliable tools, patterns, and operational guidance.

faqs.question: How often is the directory updated?
faqs.answer: Continuously. New listings, revisions, and documentation improvements are added as submissions are reviewed.

faqs.question: Where can I get help if I am stuck?
faqs.answer: Use the community space for peer help, check docs for implementation examples, or contact support for account and billing issues.
